promptFromSettingsDesc: Use the prompt configured in Settings > Prompts
countingNote: Getting real token count from Gemini API...
fallbackNote: Fallback estimation - real count will be calculated automatically.
estimationNote: Estimation based on official Gemini API documentation. Actual usage may vary.
actualNote: Actual count from Gemini API. This is the precise token usage.
adjustedNote: Real count from Gemini API, adjusted for selected media resolution.
exceedsLimit: Warning: Token count exceeds model limit. Consider reducing FPS or using a higher-capacity model.
timingGenerationDesc: Generate timing for your provided subtitles
useTranscriptionRulesDesc: Include context, terminology, and formatting rules from video analysis in the prompt. When enabled, these analysis rules derived from video content will be embedded in the prompt to improve subtitle quality and formatting consistency. Note: This may sometimes cause timing shifts for subtitles.
noAnalysisAvailable: Please create analysis by pressing "Add analysis" button
mediaResolutionHelp: 64 or 256 tokens cannot be mapped to an exact resolution; this reflects Gemini's proprietary video information extraction method.
notifyOutsideResultsDesc: Include immediately-before/after subtitles outside the selected range to improve consistency
outsideContextRangeDesc: How many subtitles before/after to include as context. The last value is Unlimited.
maxDurationPerRequestDesc: Maximum duration for each Gemini request. Longer segments will be split into parallel requests.
segmentProcessingDelayDesc: 0 = all segments at once (fastest). Set higher values to process segments sequentially (e.g., 10 seconds delay between each segment). This will help ease the penalty of rate limits as well as less lags on weaker computers
delayOnlyWithParallel: Only available when there are multiple requests
autoSplitHelp: Automatically split long subtitles into smaller segments for better readability. The splitting happens in real-time during streaming.
maxWordsHelp: Maximum number of words allowed per subtitle. Longer subtitles will be split evenly.
autoSplitNote: Subtitles will be split evenly when they exceed this limit. For example, a 12-word subtitle with a 5-word limit will be split into 4-4-4 words (not 5-5-2).
gemini25ProFpsNote: Note: Gemini 2.5 Pro requires FPS â‰¥ 1 for compatibility
timingGenerationDescDisabled: Add subtitles to enable timing generation
gemini20Warning: Gemini 2.5 models have higher censorship and are prone to "unsafe content" errors.
inlineExtractionHelp: Prioritize the old method for full video, but use the new method when you need to recreate a specific segment
inlineExtractionLabel: Cut the video locally, then send to Gemini
methodNewOption: New: Interact with video on Files API
methodOldOption: Old: Cut the video locally, then send to Gemini
parakeetStrategyHelp: If choosing sentence splitting, you should use the subtitle splitting button (left of Save button) afterwards for shorter lengths.
parakeetPreserveSentencesHelp: When enabled, subtitles are preserved by sentence, regardless of length. When disabled, long sentences are split evenly by word count, with timings here being more accurate according to word ranges and smarter than splitting with the "Split subtitles" button to the left of the "Save" button.
parakeetMaxWordsHelp: Based on this condition to evenly split sentences until satisfied.
parakeetMaxWordsHelpWordStrategy: Number of words in each subtitle when splitting by word count. Ignores punctuation
parakeetMaxDurationHelp: For Parakeet, if split, segments are processed one by one (sequentially) instead of in parallel like Gemini. Long durations may cause lag on machines with weak GPUs
parakeetMaxCharsHelp: System automatically adjusts character distribution and timings to avoid breaking words.
transcriptionMethodNewDescription: Interact with video via Files API. Should be used when creating subs for a specific segment. Works well with Gemini 2.5 Pro. Understands both audio and video.
transcriptionMethodOldDescription: Cut the video locally, then send to Gemini, suitable for creating subs for the entire video in the early stages. Works well with all models. Understands both audio and video.
transcriptionMethodParakeetDescription: Local processing with Nvidia Parakeet, only supports some languages. Only extracts from audio in video.
transcriptionMethodWhisperDescription: Generate multilingual subtitles with OpenAI Whisper based on provided audio, free to use via Groq API. (This method is currently in development)
audioFpsDisabled: FPS settings are not applicable for audio files
audioResolutionDisabled: Resolution settings are not applicable for audio files
methodHelpVercel: Only the new method is available in Vercel version. The old method requires server-side video processing capabilities.
maxDurationAudioVercel: Parallel processing is not available for audio files in Vercel version. Audio files must be processed as a single request.
maxDurationAudioNewMethod: Parallel processing is not available for audio files with the new method. Use the old method for audio parallel processing.
audioRangeAdjusted: Audio processing using Gemini new method will auto adjust your range to the whole video
segmentProcessingSequential: Processing {{count}} segments sequentially ({{delay}}s delay between each)
changeTranscriptionMethodRetryLocked: Cannot change method while in retry mode with old Gemini method
